game.name: Quick Cross
game.history: In 1997,Quick Cross was made by the Great American Trading Company.
game.board: A 4x4 board with a cross shape in each space.
game.tomove: Players either place a piece or switch the direction of the piece in subsequent moves.
game.towin: The first person to get four in a row vertically, horizontally or diagonally wins.
game.rules: The first player places one of the sixteen pieces on the board in any direction. The next player then either adds a piece or switches the direction of a piece on the board. Play continues until one person gets four in a row horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

variant.name: Misere
variant.description: To force your opponent into getting four in a row either vertically, horizontally or diagonally.

variant.name: Corners And Diagonals
variant.description: The player to score all four corners or diagonals wins.

references.reference: Quick Cross: The Strategy Game. The Great American Trading Company. 1997.
